briefdescription.para: Linked list of DAG link pointers.

detaileddescription.para: Because the same link structure is used for forward and reverse links, as well as for the agenda used in bestpath search, we can't store the list pointer inside latlink_t. We could use glist_t here, but it wastes 4 bytes per entry on 32-bit machines.

briefdescription.para: Segmentation "iterator" for backpointer table results.
Partial path structure used in N-best (A*) search.

detaileddescription.para: Each partial path (latpath_t) is constructed by extending another partial pathparentby one node.

briefdescription.para: A* search structure.
Segmentation "iterator" for A* search results.
Construct an empty word graph with reference to a search structure.
Insert penalty for fillers.
Remove nodes marked as unreachable.
Add an edge to the traversal queue.
Remove an edge from the traversal queue.
Clear and reset the traversal queue.
Create a new lattice link element.
Get hypothesis string after bestpath search.
Get hypothesis segmentation iterator after bestpath search.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_lattice_t *dag, ngram_model_t *lmset, float32 lwf, int sf, int ef, int w1, int w2)
memberdef.name: ps_astar_start

briefdescription.para: Begin N-Gram based A* search on a word graph.

parameterdescription.para: Ending frame for N-best search, or -1 for last frame.
First context word, or -1 for none.
Second context word, or -1 for none.

briefdescription.para: Find next best hypothesis of A* on a word graph.

simplesect.para: a complete path, or NULL if no more hypotheses exist.

briefdescription.para: Finish N-best search, releasing resources associated with it.
Get hypothesis string from A* search.
Get hypothesis segmentation from A* search.
